channel.title: SCAR Help
channel.description:
Hello guys.
Not sure if this is the right place so I'll post it here for now. I currently have enjoyed my macroing experience on 1 account. But I'd like to know how I get multiple accounts on at once so I can actually have like 3 accounts mining ess.
All help is aprreciated. Thanks.

item.title: SCAR Help
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

SCAR is a human emulator, if you like. You can’t run multiple accounts at the same time, unless you use either a virtual PC, another pc in real life or help from a third party program, or plugin. I currently use my brother’s pc overnight and soon will be buying a second hand PC and using that one full-time.

Cruel has discovered how to get colours from a client that’s been covered by another application, so multiple scar’s could be possible in a few months.

Read full topic

item.title: SCAR Help
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

What you’re looking for isn’t possible without the help of a bot, but like junkj said, SRL scripts will log out of a character that’s either gotten stuck or fulfilled the requirements and will rotate to the next autoer until all of the characters are inactive.

You can find some SRL scripts here, or here. For the last link, you’ll have to register at that site if you haven’t done so.

-Weibs.

Read full topic

item.title: SCAR Help
item.dc:creator: @junkj junkj
item.description:
@junkj wrote:

Well its not realy at once, it logs out onto the next player.

use from the procedure below.

procedure DeclarePlayers;
 Begin                         {dont touch this!}
    HowManyPlayers := 1;
    NumberOfPlayers(HowManyPlayers);    // Sets the Players Array Length;
    CurrentPlayer := 0;                 // CeurrentPlayer = Array Index
                              {just touch this!}
    Players[0].Name := '';        //Username
    Players[0].Pass := '';           //Password
    Players[0].Nick := '';             //3 or 4 letters username
    Players[0].Loc := '';                  //Dont touch this
    Players[0].Active := True;
end;

to add more players, copy below
{just touch this}

and change
HowManyPlayers := 1;

to how many players you want and keep adding

{just touch this}

until you get the players your want.

then for how many players you haveto the left of the word under {just touch this},
look to the left.You will see players, the number zero represents the number of the player.

make the numbers go in order. (1 2 3 4 5) ect
if you need any questons, post or pm me.

Read full topic
